intro: Eschenbachia ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous eschenbachia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Eschenbachia ambigua is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
